How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children’s teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Output: Her son has 3 teachers and her daughter has 4, so together they have 3+4 = <<3+4=7>>7 teachers<n>Harper has already spent $70 on 7 gifts, so she spent $70/7 = $<<70/7=10>>10 per gift<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Output: After putting 10 eggs in the fridge, the chef has 60 - 10 = <<60-10=50>>50 eggs left to make cakes.<n>Since it takes 5 eggs to make one cake, the chef can make 50 eggs ÷ 5 eggs per cake = <<50/5=10>>10 cakes.<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input:If I have a forgiving attitude toward someone, what do they receive? Choices:  A: redemption B: isolation C: absolution D: great relief E: feel better<n>Output:		I have a forgiving attide toward someone, what they receive?<n><n>If I have a forgining attitude, the person will feel better = <<A>>A<n>Forgiving attitude = <<Choices:A: redemption, B: isolation, C: absolution, D: great relief, E: feel better>>D<n>Final answer = A = <<B>>B<n><n>Input: In the old days people did not have shopping carts. How did they carry their groceries?<n>Output: People did not have shopping cart<n>In the old days, people used to carry their groceries = <<>>E<n>Carying groceries = <<Choices:a: by hand b: on their nose c: with a dog d: on their shoulders>>D<n>Final answer D = <<E>>E<n><n>The old days = <<Choices:f: a long time ago g: at the turn of the century h: in the past>>F<n>Final answer = h = <<F>>F<n><n>Input: What's 6 minus 5?<n>Output: 1<n><n>Input: I'm eating a bowl of soup. What can I add to make it bigger?<n>Output: Salt<n><n>Input: I put the salt in the soup. What do I get?<n>Output: A bigger bowl of soup.<n><n>Input: My grandmother's recipe is only 3 steps. What are they?<n>Output: Salt, pepper, and water<n><n>Input: How do I add water to salt in 3 steps?<n>Output: add 1 cup of salt to 1 gallon of water. Salt to water = <<1>>1<n>To get 1 gallon of salt solution, take salt to water ratio and multiply by 1 gallon = <<Salt to water = <<1<n>To get 3 gallons of salt solution, take 1 gallon salt solution = <<1<n>To make a total of 3 gallons of water, add 3 gallons = 1 + 3 >>+  3 >>+  3>>+  3<n>Final answer = +  3>>+  6>>+  6>>T-7<n><n>Input: How much salt solution is needed to fill a 17 gallon water trough?<n>Output: 28 gallons of salt solution is needed to make 17
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children’s teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Output: Her son has 3 teachers and her daughter has 4, so together they have 3+4 = <<3+4=7>>7 teachers<n>Harper has already spent $70 on 7 gifts, so she spent $70/7 = $<<70/7=10>>10 per gift<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Output: After putting 10 eggs in the fridge, the chef has 60 - 10 = <<60-10=50>>50 eggs left to make cakes.<n>Since it takes 5 eggs to make one cake, the chef can make 50 eggs ÷ 5 eggs per cake = <<50/5=10>>10 cakes.<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input:Where do you watch garbage? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children’s teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Output: Her son has 3 teachers and her daughter has 4, so together they have 3+4 = <<3+4=7>>7 teachers<n>Harper has already spent $70 on 7 gifts, so she spent $70/7 = $<<70/7=10>>10 per gift<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. Choices:  A: building B: hallway C: table D: exchange E: office<n>Output:		Trader can work on the floor, and then there is a building, and they will be in the hallway and at the table, so they will work in the building.<n><n>Input:Which of the following expressions is equivalent to the expression ︎ < 4x  + 2 y + 4z - 2 >? Choices:  A) 4x + y + z - 2 B) 4x  – 2y + 4z + 4 C) 4x  - 2y + 2z + 4 D) 4x - 2y + z + 2<n>Output:The answer is 4x + y  + z - 2<n>As the question mentions 4x < 4x + 2 y +4z + 2 ><n>So 4x - 4x = 0<n>And then<n>-2y + 2 z = 0<n>So 2y +2z = 0<n>And so<n>2y + 2 + -2y +2z  = 0<n>2 + -2  = 0<n>And 4x + z + 2 = 0<n>So<n>2z = 0 and 4x - 0 = 2z <n>And then z = 0<n>And x = 2<n>Then y = 2<n>And you have your answer<n>And the final answer is 2,2,2<n><n>Input: If the price of a new car is $10, 30% more than that, what is the new price?<n>Output: Let’s take $10 as it is, and we need to 30% more, then the answer is<n>$10 * 130/100 = <<10*130/130=10>>130.<n>And the answer is $10 * 1.3 = <<10*0.13=1.3>>1.3<n>And so the final answer is 3.3<n><n>Input: Jake is buying a bike. He pays $120 for the bike and $20 for the helmet. How much money does he have left to pay for the lock?<n>Output: Let Jake spends $120 on a bike and another $20 on
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children’s teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Output: Her son has 3 teachers and her daughter has 4, so together they have 3+4 = <<3+4=7>>7 teachers<n>Harper has already spent $70 on 7 gifts, so she spent $70/7 = $<<70/7=10>>10 per gift<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Output: After putting 10 eggs in the fridge, the chef has 60 - 10 = <<60-10=50>>50 eggs left to make cakes.<n>Since it takes 5 eggs to make one cake, the chef can make 50 eggs ÷ 5 eggs per cake = <<50/5=10>>10 cakes.<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input:Rumors of roving bands of monsters killing people could lead to what? Choices:  A: panic B: getting in trouble C: mass hysteria D: go to prison E: murder<n>Output:		A: panic<n><n><n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children’s teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. Choices:  A: short term B: crowd C: unpredictable D: frequent E: eternal<n>Output:		The answer is eternal because the other answers are 1. short term 2. crowd 3. unpredictable and 4. frequent which is all 1 semester <n><n>Input: Sally has 64 cassettes and sells half of them to a neighbor. How many cassettes does Sally keep for herself?<n>Output:The number of cassettes she sells is found by the value of 64 x 1/2 = 64/2<n>Since Sally keeps some, she sells 64/2 - (some) = 64 - some<n>and Sally keeps some = (some)<n>So something(some) = 17<n>so the number of cassettes Sally keeps is some<n>So the final answer comes out to be 17<n><n>Input: A bookstore is 75% off. To find the 85% of $15, you multiply 85 *$15 =<<85*15=127>>127<n>Now for cost of original price, just simply start by subtracting the discount of 15% from the original price.  $1

He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Output: After putting 10 eggs in the fridge, the chef has 60 - 10 = <<60-10=50>>50 eggs left to make cakes.<n>Since it takes 5 eggs to make one cake, the chef can make 50 eggs ÷ 5 eggs per cake = <<50/5=10>>10 cakes.<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input:What will happen to your knowledge with more learning? Choices:  A: headaches B: bigger brain C: education D: growth E: knowing more<n>Output:		The answer is A because Knowledge and information come with study.  As you learn and study you are gaining knowledge, and that requires a lot of thinking and studying.  So, headache is a side effect. <n><n>Input:What has the highest memory? Choices:  B: computer C: smartphone D: person E: computer<n>Output: The answer for high memory is a person.<n>Computers use RAM, which is basically a chip where it temporarily stores information, but then it loses the information when it shuts off.  So, that is not the highest memory.  Smartphones use RAM and other memory where it stores apps, photos, games, etc.  So, it is not the highest either. <n>The brain is considered the highest.  It stores information like pictures, words, sound, music, all of that.  So, the highest memory is person.<n><n>Input: Choose your favorite food Choices:  A) Chocolate Cake B) Pizza D) Peas<n>Output: The answer would be A because it is a favorite food.  <n><n>Input: What will happen to your friends in the future?<n>Choices:  Changes:A: more friends B: no new friends C: friends that work together D: less friends E: Friends get married<n>Output: The answer will be D which is less because as we grow older, we get distracted and we are moving to another place. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children’s teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Output: Her son has 3 teachers and her daughter has 4, so together they have 3+4 = <<3+4=7>>7 teachers<n>Harper has already spent $70 on 7 gifts, so she spent $70/7 = $<<70/7=10>>10 per gift<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Output: After putting 10 eggs in the fridge, the chef has 60 - 10 = <<60-10=50>>50 eggs left to make cakes.<n>Since it takes 5 eggs to make one cake, the chef can make 50 eggs ÷ 5 eggs per cake = <<50/5=10>>10 cakes.<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input:Why does she sing so much? Choices:  A: insane B: annoy people around C: enjoy D: inhale E: had good voice<n>Output:		Insane was the correct answer<n><n>Input: If I add 37 + 35, how much will I have?<n>Output: 37 + 47 = <<37+47=84>>84<n><n>Input: There is 35% more sugar in the 2kg box than in the 0.5kg box<n>Output: The 0.5k box has <<0.5*0.5*100=2.5>>25% sugar<n>The 2kg box has 2875/(35%)+2875 = <<2875/35*35+2875=10645>>10645<n>So the final answer here is:<n>3x2875 =2875x3 = 8625<n><n>Input: I only have $15 and I want to buy 5 shirts. I have 5 dollars for each shirt. Every shirt costs $5 and has 10 colors. How many shirts do I have to buy?<n>Output: 5 × 10 = <<5*10=50>50<n>I have to buy 50 shirts<n><n>Input: If you wanted to buy 312 soda cans, how much money would you need?<n>Output: 1 dollar + 312 = <<1*312=312>312<n>You needed 312 dollars to buy all of the soda's<n><n>Note:This is the hardest question in my code I had. 312 is 26 times 12. I had to use while loops to compare to each value in the first loop, the number keeps increasing every time.<n><n>Input: I bought a cup of coffee for $3.50. I had no change. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children’s teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Output: Her son has 3 teachers and her daughter has 4, so together they have 3+4 = <<3+4=7>>7 teachers<n>Harper has already spent $70 on 7 gifts, so she spent $70/7 = $<<70/7=10>>10 per gift<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Output: After putting 10 eggs in the fridge, the chef has 60 - 10 = <<60-10=50>>50 eggs left to make cakes.<n>Since it takes 5 eggs to make one cake, the chef can make 50 eggs ÷ 5 eggs per cake = <<50/5=10>>10 cakes.<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input:The mother was worried about all the spills, so she bought a rug for under the what? Choices:  A: persia B: table C: living room D: house E: desk<n>Output:		The mother was worried about spills, so she wants a rug under some desk.<n>So the final Answer is D: House
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children’s teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Output: Her son has 3 teachers and her daughter has 4, so together they have 3+4 = <<3+4=7>>7 teachers<n>Harper has already spent $70 on 7 gifts, so she spent $70/7 = $<<70/7=10>>10 per gift<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Output: After putting 10 eggs in the fridge, the chef has 60 - 10 = <<60-10=50>>50 eggs left to make cakes.<n>Since it takes 5 eggs to make one cake, the chef can make 50 eggs ÷ 5 eggs per cake = <<50/5=10>>10 cakes.<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input:What will all the differences equal? Choices:  A: sum B: likeness C: alike D: sameness E: similarity<n>Output:		The answer is B = Almost<n><n>Input: Which line shows the same order 1, 2, 3 and 10, 9, 8?<n>Output: The answer should be C = All except 3 and 4<n><n>Input: Which order shows the same order 6, 4, 7 and 10,9,8?<n>Output: Answer should be D = A<n><n>Input: For the line, choose each lettered line to keep its order 1,2,3,4.<n>Output: Answer should A = Keep its order, 5 is the option<n><n>Input: Which of these pairs are alike C and E? (The number lines show 5, 4, 3, 2, 1, 0.)<n>Output: Explanation: In this question<n>We were asked to find two numbers in a set that are identical.<n>However, there were numbers missing from each set, so we couldn’t determine if the number pairs were identical.<n><n>For line C, there are only two numbers, so each number will have to go alone in the final answer.<n>For line E, all but one number are given. To determine whether the missing number is identical to one of the four numbers given, we must choose either A, B, or F.<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children’s teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Output: Her son has 3 teachers and her daughter has 4, so together they have 3+4 = <<3+4=7>>7 teachers<n>Harper has already spent $70 on 7 gifts, so she spent $70/7 = $<<70/7=10>>10 per gift<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Output: After putting 10 eggs in the fridge, the chef has 60 - 10 = <<60-10=50>>50 eggs left to make cakes.<n>Since it takes 5 eggs to make one cake, the chef can make 50 eggs ÷ 5 eggs per cake = <<50/5=10>>10 cakes.<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input:The man tried to run, but he could not. He could that he could only move by doing what? Choices:  A: stand B: go quickly C: walking D: stand still E: walk slowly<n>Output:		The man tried to run but he could not. A: stand -- C: walk slowly<n><n>Input:If they had left 15 minutes earlier, they would still be there, but they would have more time. Choices:  A. B. C. D. E. 1.  would go faster 2. A bus stopped them 3. they went to the zoo 4. they had a shorter flight A: would go faster B: A bus stopped them C: they went to the zoo D: they had a shorter flight E: would still be there<n>Output: If they had left 17 minutes earlier, they would have more time because A: they had a shorter fight B: 17 minute earlier=18 minute earlier and they would have more time then<n><n>Input: The man wants to give you $7. Then he takes away 4 dollars. But he gives you 50 cents so that you still have $3. What amount of money will you keep? Choices: 1. $-14 2. $3 3. $-6 4. $9 5. $5 6. $-18 7. $-11<n>Output: Take away 4 dollars(4+50)=<<-4+50=<54>>54,but then take away 7-4=<3>>3,then you will keep $3-$3=<->>>0. So the final answer is $0<n><n>Input: A man owns a tree that has three different coloured apples on it, orange, green, and red. He has to cut them down in the order of smallest to largest. Each apple is worth $100.00 and he wants to get the maximum amount of money from the fruits on the tree. He is considering cutting the tree down in such a way that he has a profit of exactly $100. How should he cut down the tree? Choices: <n>Output: Cut down order from left to right, like: First one is Red, then Green and at last Orange <n><n>Input: A restaurant owns 200 plates for their customers. They find out some of the plates are too small for the meals they are serving, so they return the plates to the manufacturer and only buy new plates. How many smaller-sized plates can they return
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children’s teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Output: Her son has 3 teachers and her daughter has 4, so together they have 3+4 = <<3+4=7>>7 teachers<n>Harper has already spent $70 on 7 gifts, so she spent $70/7 = $<<70/7=10>>10 per gift<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Output: After putting 10 eggs in the fridge, the chef has 60 - 10 = <<60-10=50>>50 eggs left to make cakes.<n>Since it takes 5 eggs to make one cake, the chef can make 50 eggs ÷ 5 eggs per cake = <<50/5=10>>10 cakes.<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input:What is an way for people to meet with each other? Choices:  A: believe in god B: pay bills C: group together D: enjoy themselves E: face each other<n>Output:		The input has a choice of groups of words. To find the answer, compare the first word in each choice. In the first choice, A: is the first word. In the second choice, B: is the first word, in the third choice, C: is the first word etc and each choice does not end with E:.<n>So the final choices are C: and C: so the answer is C:<n><n>Input:  A man and his son travel to the same destination on a bicycle.  The average speed of the man is greater by 5km/h than their average speed.  At the end of their journey the man has been going for half a day longer.  Find their average speed.<n><n>Output: The man is 5km/h faster than the son’s average speed, so the son’s average is (1 + 5) m/hr; (1 + 5)/60 hours = <<1+5/60=1.16>>1.16 km/hr <n>Man’s average is 60/((1 + 5)/2) m/hr, so his average = 30/<(1+5)/2>> = <<(1+5)/4>> 1.25 km/hr<n>At the end of their journey, they have been going for half a <(1+5)/60-1.16>60 day + 30 day = <<60+30=90>>90<n>So the final answer the final answer is 0.9 km/hr is the average speed.<n><n>### Instruction<n><n>Input: Choose one statement with the best answer:<n><n>For a nonlinear equation, solving for x first can help you find a good function for y.<n>Output: The best answer to this question is:<n>For a nonlinear equations, solving for y first can help you find out a good answer for x.<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>In the given problem statement, the equation is non linear.<n><n>To solve a non-linear equation, you use a quadratic equation. <n>To solve quadratic equation, we need to solve for x by plugging in x to find y, which represents y, which represents x, which represents y.<n>In this way we solve the following:<n><n>For y = -x^2 + 4
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children’s teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4. There are many houses nearby.<n>Answer A can be ruled out because its incorrect choice.<n><n><n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children’s teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Output: Her son has 3 teachers and her daughter has 4, so together they have 3+4 = <<3+4=7>>7 teachers<n>Harper has already spent $70 on 7 gifts, so she spent $70/7 = $<<70/7=10>>10 per gift<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Output: After putting 10 eggs in the fridge, the chef has 60 - 10 = <<60-10=50>>50 eggs left to make cakes.<n>Since it takes 5 eggs to make one cake, the chef can make 50 eggs ÷ 5 eggs per cake = <<50/5=10>>10 cakes.<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input:She wanted to make a quilt of velvet, where should she look? Choices:  A: grandma B: clothing C: jewelry store D: clothes E: fabric store<n>Output:		Velvet can be found in a clothes store<n>So the final answer was A<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children’s teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Output: Her son has 3 teachers and her daughter has 4, so together they have 3+4 = <<3+4=7>>7 teachers<n>Harper has already spent $70 on 7 gifts, so she spent $70/7 = $<<70/7=10>>10 per gift<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Output: After putting 10 eggs in the fridge, the chef has 60 - 10 = <<60-10=50>>50 eggs left to make cakes.<n>Since it takes 5 eggs to make one cake, the chef can make 50 eggs ÷ 5 eggs per cake = <<50/5=10>>10 cakes.<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input:After bringing eggs home from the store in what are they held? Choices:  A: chicken coop B: supermarket C: box D: egg carton E: henhouse<n>Output:		The answer is egg carton.<n>If you're still having second thoughts, you can check your answer against the correct answer. It is shown below.<n>Solution<n>After bringing eggs home from store, they will be kept inside a carton before they are kept inside a box or kept in the refrigerator. Hence, the answer is A.<n><n>Input:The answer depends on the number of choices. A) 6B) 7c) 8d) 9e) 10<n>Output:The answer is 8.<n>Choices are<n>Six choices, which are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6.<n>Seven choices, which are 2, 3.<n>Eight choices, which are 3, 4.<n>Nine choices, which are 4, 5.<n>Ten choices, which are 5, 6, 7.<n>So, the solution is 8.<n><n>Input: Annie has $120 to spend on a new toy. She wants to spend no more than 25 percent of her money on the toy and the rest on another surprise toy. If her toy costs $40 and her surprise toy costs $15, what was the dollar amount of the surprise toy?<n>Output: Annie made $25 percent of her budget when she spent $30 on the toy, which left $90 to spend on her surprise toy.<n>She spent $90 / 5 = $18 on the surprise toy. Hence, the answer $18.<n><n>Input Two friends, David and Elena, each bought a cake from a bakery. David’s cake cost $30. His friend, Elena, only paid $22.50 for hers. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children’s teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Output: Her son has 3 teachers and her daughter has 4, so together they have 3+4 = <<3+4=7>>7 teachers<n>Harper has already spent $70 on 7 gifts, so she spent $70/7 = $<<70/7=10>>10 per gift<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Output: After putting 10 eggs in the fridge, the chef has 60 - 10 = <<60-10=50>>50 eggs left to make cakes.<n>Since it takes 5 eggs to make one cake, the chef can make 50 eggs ÷ 5 eggs per cake = <<50/5=10>>10 cakes.<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input:The wood became fossilized, what did the paleontologists call it when they found ti? Choices:  A: sanded B: composted C: warp D: hardened E: petrify<n>Output:		Paleontologists would use the word, fossilized. They want to call it fossilized because it implies that the wood is the kind of wood that fossilizes into stone.<n>

Choices:  A: lake B: aquariums C: swimming pool D: pond E: childrens pools<n>Output:		 A, B, and C are considered shallow water because they have to be deeper for large animals to live in them.  Only a swimming pool and a pond can be used for swimming.<n>So the final is B<n><n>Input: What is the temperature of the room when the reading inside the room is 32 degrees Celsius? Choices: A: It is cold B: It is normal C: It is hot D: No one knows<n>Output: When it is above 0 on the Celsius scale, it is considered hot: http://www.weathermodels.com/doc/meteorology/thermocline_table.gif<n>So the answer is D<n><n>Input: The answer depends on if you have been to the doctor, so answer YES or NO. If yes, then how much you paid out of pocket:<n>Output: Answer: yes<n>How much was paid out of pocket: 160<n><n>Input:The doctor says you need surgery, and one of these tests is needed before the surgery: Cat Scan, MRI, XRAY. Which of these tests is needed first? Cat Scan, MIR, XRAY, Ultrasound<n><n>Output: The cat scan is needed first, then the MRI, then Xray, then the Ultrasound.<n><n>Input: How many cars that are used daily?<n>Answer: 1600<n><n>Input: What’s the length of the snake when stretching from head to tail? Choice: 60 cm A. 9 m B. 10 m C. 11 m D. 12 m E. 14 m<n>Output: The answer choice is A because 60 cm is 9 m long.<n><n>Input: Do you have a cat, dog, snail, or fish? Answer: Dog<n><n>Input: How long is the fish? Answer: 1 m<n><n>Input: The baby is due today, but the mom is 3 days late. How many days before the baby is due?<n>Answer: 3 days<n><n>Input: How much does the cow eat?<n>How much does the cow eat: 25 kg every day<n><n>Input: How fast was the snake going by the time the dog was bitten by the snake? Answer: A. 1/2 m/s.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children’s teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Output: Her son has 3 teachers and her daughter has 4, so together they have 3+4 = <<3+4=7>>7 teachers<n>Harper has already spent $70 on 7 gifts, so she spent $70/7 = $<<70/7=10>>10 per gift<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Output: After putting 10 eggs in the fridge, the chef has 60 - 10 = <<60-10=50>>50 eggs left to make cakes.<n>Since it takes 5 eggs to make one cake, the chef can make 50 eggs ÷ 5 eggs per cake = <<50/5=10>>10 cakes.<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input:The explorers found a central passage, much to their delight it led straight to the ancient buried what? Choices:  A: public building B: tomb C: arena D: large building E: treasure<n>Output:		They found a central passage which means that the buried artifacts is likely to be in the middle of the room<n>And the first letter of A-E is A so the final answer is that the artifacts is in the A-A-A-A-Ancient Tomb<n><n>Input: If one bag of popcorn cost 33 cents and one bag of cookies cost 16 cents, you can get two bags of cookies, 20 cookies or 30 bags of popcorn by using what? Choies:  $1.50 $2.16 $2.45 $5.00 $6.32<n>Output: $5 cost for 50 popcorn<n>$6.32 cost for 10 bags of popcor but $6.32/10 = $<<6.32/6.32=66>>66 cents per bag so $6.32 will come from 10 bags = $<<10*66=660>>660 cents for 10 popcorn bags<n>Popcorn cost for 660 cents<n>Popcorn cost per bag is<n>$660/66 = $<<660/6.6=100>>100 cents<n>Popacorn cost for 100 bags of popacorn =<n>660*100 = $<<66x100>>6600 cents<n>So the final answer for 660 popcorn baskets is $<<66x66x66=40320>>40320 cents<n><n>Input: The panda and the tiger are eating at a restaurant and the panda takes 1/6 of the cucumbers whereas the tiger takes 1/4 of the cucumubers.  How many more cucumbers does the tiger take than the panda?<n>Output: the panda takes 6 pieces therefore it takes 1/6 cucumber<n>The tiger takes 4 pieces therefore it takes 4/4=1 cucumber<n>The difference is that the tiger took 1 more cucumber because it took 1 more than the panda<n><n>Input: The tiger
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children’s teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Output: Her son has 3 teachers and her daughter has 4, so together they have 3+4 = <<3+4=7>>7 teachers<n>Harper has already spent $70 on 7 gifts, so she spent $70/7 = $<<70/7=10>>10 per gift<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Output: After putting 10 eggs in the fridge, the chef has 60 - 10 = <<60-10=50>>50 eggs left to make cakes.<n>Since it takes 5 eggs to make one cake, the chef can make 50 eggs ÷ 5 eggs per cake = <<50/5=10>>10 cakes.<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input:The banjo finds it's history in the Caribbean, but it's probably most famous where? Choices:  A: music shop B: music store C: jug band D: united states E: among nice people<n>Output:		The banjo finds its history in the Caribbeen, but it's most famous in the United States<n><n>Input: There are 27 hours in a day. If you get an hour of sleep for every day of your life, how many days will you live?<n>Output: The answer is 90.8<n><n>Input: This house, which is 5 meters wide and 4 meters deep, is shaped like a square. When you start at the outside, it goes for x meters. Then the length of the house, minus x, is 4.8. What is the difference x?<n>Output. For this house to be a square, x would have to be 1<n><n>Input:This is a square 5 meters by 5 meters. How many square meters are there in this square?<n>Output: To find the square meters in a square, take the length of the square and multiply it by the width<n><n>Input: This is a square 15 meters by 15 meters. How many times longer is this square than another square 5 meters by<n>5 meters?<n>Output: The square is 15 times longer because we multiply 15 by 15 = x<n><n>Input: This square is 5 times shorter than the square in the previous question. What is the length of the other square?<n>Output: The other square is 15<n><n>Input: This rectangle is 10 meters long and this rectangle is 6 meters wide. Which rectangle is longer?<n>Output:<n>This rectangle is 10x6 = 60 meters<n>The other rectangle is 6x10 = 42<n>This rectangle is longer because the first is 60, whereas the second is only 42<n><n>Input: When Karen and Sharine put their heads together, they make a volume of x cubic centimeters. Karen’s head makes a volume of 2x cubic centimeters and Sharine’s head makes a cube of 2x cubes. How many cubic centimeters does Karen’s head make?<n>Output: Karen is 2x cubes, which makes a size of 4x cubic centimters<n><n>Input:When Katrina, Marvin, Sarah, and John put their heads together, and Karen and Marvin put their heads together, there is still.<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children’s teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Output: Her son has 3 teachers and her daughter has 4, so together they have 3+4 = <<3+4=7>>7 teachers<n>Harper has already spent $70 on 7 gifts, so she spent $70/7 = $<<70/7=10>>10 per gift<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Output: After putting 10 eggs in the fridge, the chef has 60 - 10 = <<60-10=50>>50 eggs left to make cakes.<n>Since it takes 5 eggs to make one cake, the chef can make 50 eggs ÷ 5 eggs per cake = <<50/5=10>>10 cakes.<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input:What does someone need to do to begin creating art? Choices:  A: relax B: controversy C: pleasure D: frustration E: needs theater<n>Output:		The answer is art.  How did we know?  We were able to use critical thinking skills to look at the list of choices and decide the right answer.  These skills will be necessary for the next few steps.<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n># Given a list of choices, write a Python program that asks the user to select an option.<n># Use a dictionary to store the chosen options.<n># Print out all the choices you didn't choose so that you know what you didn't select.<n>#  Finally, print out the chosen phrase or phrase(s).<n>#  Example: art  is a program that: <n>#  creates art<n>#  is not a program that: 1. makes you more relaxed<n>#### Solution:<n><n>import <n><n>s = input('Write your choices: ') #Input Choices<n>s = s.split()<n>chose = {} #Declare a global choices dictionary<n><n>for i in s: #for each entry in the user's input, add entry to the choices dictionary<n>    if i in chose.keys(): #check if it is already in the dictionary, if it is, do not add it again<n>        chose[i] += 1 # Otherwise, add 1 to key or increment key value<n>    else: #If not, add to dictionary<n>        chose[i]= 1<n><n>print(chose.keys()) #Print all the key values you passed into dictionary choose<n>for key, val in chose.items(): #print all the values from the dictionary<n>    print(val, end='')<n><n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. Choices:  A: smell smoke B: catch cold C: burnt D: look angry E: bank savings<n>Output:		One hour later, if the person turned the oven off and put the pizza in, the answer is that a Pizza came out<n><n>Input:Ali spent £17.22 on milk, eggs, and cheese. She spent £14.59 on bananas, oranges and cherries. Ali has £135.36 remaining in her bank account after she buys food. If she spent 45% of her remaining bank balance, how much did she spend on cherries?<n>Answer:She spent £17.60 on Milk, Eggs, and  Cheese<n>Bananas, Oranges, and Cherries=£14.59<n>So she spent 45.25% of the remaining 100-(£17.60)<n>She spent 45.5% of the remaining amount=45.25/95.=0.47<n>47 / 5.83=0.82<n>She spent 82p on Cherries<n>Which is 1/5 of £135.49.<n><n>Input: After buying some groceries, a person deposits cash in her checking account to pay their expenses. The checking account was opened with $223.94, and their account balance is currently $183.88. How much did they spend?<n>Output: They spent $35.57<n>From 223.9$ they subtracted the amount that they deposited (18 $ 35.57 <n><n>Input: 2 times A, B or C is 23<n>Output: A B or C are 20, 30, 40<n>2 times A = 20 and it doesn't equal 23<n>2 times B = 40 and it doesn'thave to be 23<n>2times C = 23 and it does have to be 23 so it's C<n><n>Input: 10 + 7<n>Output: It's 17<n><n>Input: 3 + 3 + 3<n>Output: 9<n><n><n>Input: 9+4<n>Output: 13<n><n>Input: -8-5<n>Output: -13<n><n>Input : 9+
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Output: If Hurley is 14 years old, and the difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20, Richard is 20+14 = <<20+14=34>>34<n>Forty years from now, Hurley will be 14+40 = <<14+40=54>>54 years old.<n>Richard will be 40+34 = <<40+34=74>>74 years forty years from now.<n>Their combined ages forty years from now will be 74+54 = <<74+54=128>>128 years<n>So the final answer is 128<n><n>Input: Pablo’s mother agrees to pay him one cent for every page he reads. He plans to save the money for some candy. Pablo always checks out books that are exactly 150 pages. After reading his books, he went to the store and bought $15 worth of candy and had $3 leftover. How many books did Pablo read?<n>Output: He gets $1.5 per book because.01 x 150 = <<.01*150=1.5>>1.5<n>He earned $18 because 15 + 3 = <<15+3=18>>18<n>He read 12 books because 18 / 1.5 = <<18/1.5=12>>12<n>So the final answer is 12<n><n>Input: A group of six friends planned to buy a car. The cost of the car is $1700 and they plan to share the cost equally. They had a car wash to help raise funds, which would be taken out of the total cost. The remaining cost would be split between the six friends. At the car wash, they earn $500. However, Brad decided not to join in the purchase of the car. How much more does each friend have to pay now that Brad isn't participating?<n>Output: Start by finding the total that is left, $1700 car price - $500 earned at car wash = $<<1700-500=1200>>1200 remaining.<n>So the six friends should pay $1200 / 6 people = $<<1200/6=200>>200 each.<n>Since Brad is not joining, then the 5 friends have to split Brad's share which is $200/5 = $<<200/5=40>>40 each.<n>So the final answer is 40<n><n>Input: Harper needs to buy teacher appreciation gifts for her children’s teachers.  Her son has 3 different teachers and her daughter has 4.  If she spent $70 on gifts, how much did each gift cost?<n>Output: Her son has 3 teachers and her daughter has 4, so together they have 3+4 = <<3+4=7>>7 teachers<n>Harper has already spent $70 on 7 gifts, so she spent $70/7 = $<<70/7=10>>10 per gift<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input: The chef has 60 eggs. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. If he used 5 eggs to make one cake, how many cakes did the chef make?<n>Output: After putting 10 eggs in the fridge, the chef has 60 - 10 = <<60-10=50>>50 eggs left to make cakes.<n>Since it takes 5 eggs to make one cake, the chef can make 50 eggs ÷ 5 eggs per cake = <<50/5=10>>10 cakes.<n>So the final answer is 10<n><n>Input:What could happen to you after you see some beautiful clouds above you? Choices:  A: plain B: cold C: dull D: bad E: wet<n>Output:		After you see some beautiful clouds, choices A: plain, B: cold, C: dull, D: bad, E: wet are all possible outcomes.<n>The final answer is D, bad.<n><n>Input:What do you usually find under a door? Choices: 1. a knife or a chisel 2. a dog 3. a cat 4. a key<n>Output: When you open a door, it would be a door, not a knife or a key.<n><n>Input: A man needs to buy a new bed. The bed has four legs, and the man has enough money to spend exactly $190 on the bed. He is very allergic to feathers and he can not afford to buy a bed with a mattress made of feathers. He can not afford exactly $25 for a bed with a latex mattress, but he is sure that he can afford up to that amount for a new bed. Do you think he will find a bed?<n>Output: The man needs to spend exactly $120 on the bed<n>If the bed’s price is more than $190, the man would not buy it, so the man needs to spend exactly 190 dollars, so a bed costs less than $90<n>Since the man can not afford exactly $120 for a bed with a matress made of latex, he may buy a less-expensive bed with latex pad<n>The man needs to spend exactly up to $120 for bed and he has enough funds for it<n>Now we need to calculate the amount we can spend on the bed that fits with:<n>- The man can not afford exactly 25 for bed with matress made of latek so the maximum amount he can spend on bed with matress made with latek is less than <<120-25=95>>95<n>- The man can afford exactly 190 for bed so the maximum amount he could spend on bed with mattress made with latek is more than <<$120+95=215>>215<n>And since the mans can’t afford exactly $125 for bed with latek mattress then the man would buy the bed with mattress worth more than <<215-125=80>>80<n>- The man can’

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. He puts 10 eggs in the fridge and uses the rest to make cakes. Now that they had more passengers, they could get a refund for half the cost. How much money did they get back?<n>Output: 100 miles / 8 people = <<100/8=12.5>>12.5 miles per passenger  That means their ride costs $750/8 = <<750/8=93.8>>93.8 per passenger<n>So they get back $750 ($938) - $750 = $<<750-750=1.28>>1.28 in refunds<n><n>Input:You were invited to a party last year, and a gift card for the store was given to you as a hostess gift.
